markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

governing.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of Governing magazine, a monthly publication providing news and analysis of politics, policy, and management.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Governing is owned by e.Republic, a private California-based media and research company. In addition to Governing, e.Republic owns the national magazine Government Technology and the tech business site Techwire. Governing.com earns revenue through advertising.

Content

Governing states that its readership consists of “elected, appointed, and career officials” working in state and local governments, as well as those holding professional government positions such as public accountants and educators. Content on the site reflects the interests of that readership, providing news and analysis on policy topics ranging from infrastructure to public sector pensions. The Data section provides statistics on job growth, suicide rates, and the cost of climate change for individual counties in the U.S.

The site also has sections covering women in government and public officials of the year and hosts original podcasts such as Go Public, which tells “stories of government getting it done.”

Credibility

Governing’s stories regularly provide in-depth reporting. The site generally uses data and statistics from reliable sources such as government records and Gallup polls. Headlines on the site are straightforward and reflect the content of stories. Commentary is generally labeled as such at the top of articles.

In 2018, Governing won a Jesse H. Neal Award, which recognizes excellence in specialized journalism. The award was for “Andrew the Unloved,” a profile of New York Governor Andrew Cuomo. A 2011 Erdos & Morgan Opinion Leaders Survey, which researches the influence of media influence, rated Governing as the second most widely read print publication for state and local government leaders after USA Today, and the third most influential after The Wall Street Journal and The New York Times.

Governing.com does not state a corrections policy, but NewsGuard found examples of corrections, which are generally noted at the bottom of stories.

Transparency

Governing generally names the authors of its stories and provides information about them, often including email addresses and social media handles. On the About page, visitors can find a list of Governing’s staff, including the names of senior editors and management. The page also discloses the magazine’s ownership by e.Republic.

Advertising and sponsored content are clearly distinguishable from editorial content.

History

Governing was first published in 1987. In 2009, e.Republic bought the magazine from the Times Publishing Company, the parent of The St. Petersburg Times (now The Tampa Bay Times).

Written by:
Evan Haddad

Edited by:
Amy Westfeldt John Gregory
